intro: Nestoria, commonly known as the mountain beauty or false lilies of the valley, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Primulaceae. It comprises about 20 species, predominantly found in the mountainous regions of South America, particularly in Argentina and Chile. The plants are characterized by their showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. Nestoria species are typically herbaceous perennials with hairy stems and opposite leaves. They are often cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens and are adapted to cool, moist environments.
